column1: Firienfeld was how the Rohirrim called the flat upland of Dunharrow
column2: a large grassy area for the encampment of soldiers and refuge-seekers.  Aragorn and the Grey Company passed through the Firienfeld on 8 March
column3: King Th√©oden and his riders arrived there the next day.

column2: -feld, means "field" and J.R.R. Tolkien left it unmodernised
column3: the Firienfield of the Index is in error., p. 770
